critique: This executive order pertains to land use and access, specifically opening up public lands in Wyoming to homesteading and desert-land entry, initially prioritizing ex-service men. It doesn't directly address ideological issues, immigration, executive power in a broad sense, or national security. It touches on federalism insofar as it manages federal lands, and economic regulation by opening land for private use. Social inclusion is slightly impacted by the preference given to ex-service men.
